data.title: A great way to see a different side of this city
data.text: My husband and I did the Twilight Tour after having been in Houston for 2 days, we got to see a different side of this city which we wouldn't have done without having taken this tour.  Learning to ride a segway didn't take long and then we were off to see the sights!  Thanks for an awesome evening and showing us your lovely city

data.title: Not really a tour -just a segway experience
data.text:
Segway of Houston was very accommodating to fit me in at the last minute.  However, instead of giving me a tour of the city and showing me the history, we just rode around on the Segway's for 2 hours.  While I admit, riding a Segway is a cool way to get around town - what I really wanted was a historical tour of the city.  

Our tour guide pointed out a section where two rivers met, and told me that is where Houston began, but did not elaborate on the actual history.  There was some sort of downtown park that housed many historical homes, and as we drove past it, our tour guide said she wasn't going to waste our time and tell us about any of the buildings in the park.  We were told we could come back later or look it up online if we were interested.

I was in town for only a few days and I was really hoping to learn about the area - not just move around and see the bayou and buildings.  

Very disappointing.

data.title: Great fall weekend activity
data.text: Our family had a great time with our guide, Charlie. Met in front of Wortham Center on time, gave briefing, and off we go ! Having lived in Houston for 4 years till 2003, and back since 2013, we saw a lot of places we normally wouldn't cover just by foot alone. So happy we did it, my daughter and her friend enjoyed it thoroughly

data.title: Didn't pick us up for our booked tour!!
data.text: DON'T BOTHER!! Wasted our time & taxi fare to pick up location.Waiting around for a tour that doesnt pick you up,despite sending confirmation email day before. Bad form Segway Houston.

data.title: Segways, not just a gimmick! Great way to see Houston!
data.text: We booked the twilight tour through Patty over the phone.  She was extremely helpful.  I always thought segways were just a gimmick but learned on this tour that they are a great way to see a lot of the city.  We covered more in 2 hours than we could have covered in two days by walking or most other means of travel.  With that being said, I recommend the twilight tour because the city is less crowded and you can cover much more ground that daytime tours in which you have to battle vehicle and pedestrian traffic.  We basically covered the whole downtown area in a safe and enjoyable way.  Our guide was knowledgeable and friendly and was quick with a joke.  I am very happy that there were only four people on our tour, I believe more than that may have taken away from our tour.

data.title: Had a great time!
data.text:
We did the twilight tour through parts of downtown Houston and Buffalo Bayou park. I learned things about Houston and visited places I didn't know that existed and I have been a Houstonian for 40 years. The guide was laid back, fun and let us spend some extra time on the segways while we waited for the other tour group to return. This is a family owned and operated business and you definitely got that personal, family feeling when booking and conversing with the guide. 

We had a private tour so we were not lumped in with another group.  This was a very nice surprise regarding how they run their business.  You aren't held back by strangers and their interests or comfort level on the segways.  

We had so much fun and I can't wait to do it again!

data.title: Splash Zone on Wheels Amazzzing
data.text: My wife's birthday weekend, we enjoyed even the rain ,Our guide Corman was absolutely stepped in local lure even for this Houston native to be blown away. Our tour wash a splash Zone enthusiast dream soaked to the bone just Awwwwesome!!!!!!! Definitely try this you'll be amazed.....

data.title: Segway tours of houston
data.text: Sophie was awesome.  Very knowledgeable.   Great tour of houston!!!  Only way to travel around downtown in the heat.

data.title: Enjoyable and fun
data.text:
My wife, two teenagers and myself did the Bayou Segway tour. 

The guide "Chris" was friendly, fun and professional. Thank you!  All other staff were nice and professional. 

First thing was to ensure everyone knew how to operate the Segway which took about 10-15 minutes. Then off we went to learn a little about the Houston bayous.  Keep in mind the actual fun just comes in riding the Segway.   Our party had ridden on Segways before. 

We stopped at a little snack shack for some water/smoothies etc since it was 100 degrees out. Which helped to take the edge the heat. 

It was fun and as any other tourist type of event it is a bit pricy.

data.title: Very fun tour
data.text: We did the Bayou tour with my three teenagers and my husband's aunt and uncle. Our guide was great! It was easy for all of us. We covered a lot of Downtown Houston including going by Minute Maid Park, Discovery Green, downtown and the Bayou. Very fun. Highly recommend.

data.title: Highly Recommend - Fun and Informative
data.text: This was a great experience from start to finish.  Our family of 5 took the Buffalo Bayou Tour last weekend and would highly recommend.  Patty will book your reservation, and she is a pro...informative and personable, and she left no questions unanswered.  None of us had ridden Segways before, but after a short lesson with our tour guide Alan, we were off and running.  My son recently moved to Houston, and this was a great way to get up to speed on some Houston history, facts and figures, as well as get a feeling for its parks and several of the downtown blocks.  Alan, the tour guide, was great.  Informative, sense of humor, full of facts, kept us moving and yet patient with our youngest (13) who was timid on the Segway at first (and is now an expert).  It was 96 degrees on our Saturday afternoon.  Hot, yes, but with the Segway doing the work, was very enjoyable.  Would do it again in a heartbeat.

data.title: So much fun!
data.text:
Wow! This was our first experience on Segways but it won't be our last!  They were so fun!  I had a concern about whether or not I could safely ride one, but our guide was meticulous about safety instructions & we never had a glitch!  We rode around a small courtyard area until we were comfortable on them and then we started the tour.  
The Segways were fun to ride, the tour along the Buffalo Bayou was wonderful and our guide, Matthew Creede, was knowledgeable and informative.  We thoroughly enjoyed the history lesson he provided.  He told us about several other things we could do while we were in Houston as well.  
If you have qualms about riding a Segway, put them aside and try it out!  You won't regret it!  They are safe and easy to ride.  We already have plans to do it again soon! 
We didn't plan ahead, but if you do you can get quite a discount (I think you get 15% off if you book 1 week ahead and 20% off if you book 2 weeks ahead).  We rode for 2 hours--so worth every minute!

data.title: Buffalo Bayou Tour
data.text: A great way to start our first visit to Houston. Tour guide presented a great historical account to match the bayou landmarks. All in all a great and educational ninety minutes.

data.title: No matter what you think you know about Houston, you WILL learn more!
data.text: Six aging native Houstonian women took the tour of downtown Houston at twilight! Matthew was an excellent guide, engaging, funny and knowledgeable. We learned a ton of stuff we never knew. Buffalo Bayou park has been transformed in recent years, it's a beautiful sight at dusk with our magnificent skyline towering in the background. Can't recommend this tour highly enough! Segways were a little scary for first-timers, but we quickly caught on and had them zipping around like pros. NOTE: Having had an accident a while back on a hoverboard, I was a little more scared than I expected to be. I didn't fall, and didn't need them, but I would have felt much more confident if I'd worn my inline skating protective pads. They do provide helmets, but I brought my own so I'd have a Gopro mount. Bring a backpack, water and mosquito repellent, too!

data.title: Great fun!
data.text: Organized a team building event for my co-workers.   We had a great time exploring downtown Houston and Buffalo Bayou on Segways.

data.title: Buffalo Bayou Tour
data.text: My two friends and I had a great time on our Segway Tour. We are all long time Houstonians and thought we knew a lot about Houston's history, but even so we learned so much!  Our guide was Mathew and he did a fantastic job. Yes, I know that people may think you look silly riding through downtown on a Segway, but it is so much fun that I say, just do it!

data.title: Outstanding couple of hours in Downtown Houston
data.text:
I've lived in Houston for 23 years and we visited parts of Downtown Houston that I had never seen before. It was an absolutely wonderful day on two wheels. The weather was perfect. We took the Houston History tour at 12 noon. We parked at the Theatre District garage ($12 for two hours), and waited in front of the Wortham Center. We spotted a small group of Segway-ers coming up the street. They rode into the large square and finished up their tour by zooming around. We met Joshua, our tour guide. We signed the waivers, put on the helmets, and got a quick tutorial on operating the Segway.
Quick note - this has to be one of the FEW companies that will allow a 12 year old to operate a Segway. The minimal age in almost every other city seems to be 14. Thanks for that!
Our tour took us to City Hall, along Buffalo Bayou, to Sam Houston Park, Market Square, and down Main Street. The two hour tour went so quickly. It was a wonderful experience, and I can't recommend it enough. We had two middle aged adults, and a 19, 17, & 12 year old in our party. This experience isn't cheap, but it's worth the money!

data.title: Fantastic introduction to Segways and a great tour
data.text: This was our first experience on Segways.  The tour guide instructed us well and we were gliding along like pros within 15 minutes.  We have lived in Houston for many years, but the tour took us on paths along Buffalo Bayou downtown that we would never reach by walking.  Our tour started at 6:00 PM and extended until after dark.  We got to cruise around downtown Houston as the lights came on.  We highly recommend the tour and we will probably come back with our kids.

data.title: We love Matthew! Great segway morning of the Buffalo Bayou!
data.text:
We had the pleasure of spending a long weekend in Houston with our 12 year old son. We have literally been on Segways all over the world and my sons favorite thing to do. So we surprised him on Valentines day with a 2 hour tour of the Buffalo Bayou. 
We were greeted by Matthews and lucky for us - the rest of the people in the reservation did not show up! :) Since we have had experience on Segways we set off
full speed!
Matthew was fantastic and gave a great tour all along the city and Bayou. Our son just loved it and said it has been one of his favorite times on a Segway to date. 
Experienced or beginner, recommend for a lovely couple of hours to see the city and learn a little about this area of Houston!

data.title: Great fun!
data.text: We have done Segway Tours in various cities and this one was the best!  Our guide had a wonderful historical knowlege of the city and gave us a fabulous tour of Buffalo Bayou. Will go again soon!
